subject: biology
title: Cell Structure and Function
description: Explore the components of animal and plant cells and their specific functions in 3D.

labSteps.title: Cell Membrane
labSteps.instruction: The cell membrane is a phospholipid bilayer that controls what enters and exits the cell. Rotate to see the full membrane.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Understand the selective permeability of the cell membrane.

labSteps.title: Nucleus
labSteps.instruction: The nucleus contains the cell's DNA and controls cell activities. Tap the nucleus to highlight it.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Identify the nucleus as the control center of the cell.

labSteps.title: Mitochondria
labSteps.instruction: Mitochondria produce ATP (energy) through cellular respiration. They are known as the powerhouses of the cell.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Understand ATP production and why cells need mitochondria.

labSteps.title: Endoplasmic Reticulum
labSteps.instruction: The ER comes in two forms: rough (with ribosomes, makes proteins) and smooth (makes lipids). Scale the model to see both.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Distinguish between rough and smooth ER functions.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the nucleus?
options: Contains DNA and controls gene expression
questions.correctAnswer: Contains DNA and controls gene expression
questions.explanation: The nucleus houses the cell's genetic material (DNA) and directs all cellular activities by controlling which proteins are made.

questions.question: Which organelle is called the 'powerhouse of the cell'?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria produce ATP (adenosine triphosphate) through cellular respiration, providing energy for all cellular processes.

questions.question: What does the cell membrane control?
options: What enters and exits the cell
questions.correctAnswer: What enters and exits the cell
questions.explanation: The cell membrane is selectively permeable, controlling the movement of substances into and out of the cell.

questions.question: Rough endoplasmic reticulum is covered with:
questions.explanation: Rough ER has ribosomes attached to its surface, which is why it appears 'rough' and is involved in protein synthesis.
